definition: to wipe/to erase/rubbing (brush stroke in painting)/to clean/to polish
sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)

sentences.english: To pronounce with a hissing sound; make sibilant.
sentences.chinese: 在同一點上發出的包含爆破音和擦音混合音。

sentences.english: The right groin area deep tenderness Obviously, no significant bone fricative and abnormal activities.
sentences.chinese: 右側腹股溝區深壓痛明顯，無明顯骨擦音及異常活動。

sentences.english: The sound is thinner and there is some sibilance in the highs of some songs.
sentences.chinese: 聲音是比較薄的並且有一些歌的高溫一些齒擦音。

definition: (phonology) coda, the part of a syllable that follows its vocalic nucleus (e.g. "u" in kòu or "n" in běn)
alveolar/consonants z, c, s produced with the tip of the tongue on the alveolar ridge
apical consonant (produced with the tip of the tongue, i.e. d or t)
labiodental (e.g. the consonant f in standard Chinese)
alveolar/consonants z, c, s produced with the tip of the tongue on the alveolar ridge
retroflex sound (e.g. in Mandarin zh, ch, sh, r)
entering tone/checked tone/one of the four tones of Middle Chinese
